section.title: abs function
section.para: Returns the absolute value of the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The abs function returns the absolute or numeric value of z, commonly written as |z|. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. abs(z) always returns a postive real value.

section.title: arg function
section.para: Returns the argument of the parameter.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The arg function returns the argument or angle of z. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. arg(z) always returns a real number. The result may be in radians or degrees depending on the current settings. The angle is always between -π and π. If z is a real number, arg(z) is 0 for positive numbers and π for negative numbers. arg(0) is undefined.

section.title: conj function
section.para: Returns the conjugate of the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The conj function returns the conjugate of z. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. The function is defined as: conj(z) = re(z) - &imag;*im(z)

section.title: re function
section.para: Returns the real part of the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The re function returns the real part of z. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number.

section.title: im function
section.para: Returns the imaginary part of the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The im function returns the imaginary part of z. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number.
